INSTRUMENT OF DESIGNATION AND DELEGATION
I, Lena Metlege Diab, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, repeal the former Immigration Instrument of Delegation dated March 11, 2025 and,
pursuant to section 6 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (the Act), hereby establish:
Persons whose position is set out in Column 4 of an item of the attached schedule (designated officers) to carry out the powers and duties set out in
column 3 of that item for the purpose of the provision(s) of the Act and/or Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (the Regulations) set out in
column 2 of that item;
Persons designated as officers to carry out the powers and duties set out in column 3 of the item for the purpose of the provision(s) of the Act and/or
Regulations set out in column 2 of that item include

an official of the Department of Citizenship and Immigration (CIC)1 or of the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) who is required to

Americas and the Caribbean

Europe, Maghreb and Multilaterals

Middle East

Sub-Saharan Africa

Indo-Pacific

management of regional resources in the geographic area of responsibility.

Designation – Cancel a temporary resident visa
Determine whether
the foreign national is inadmissible;
the foreign national did not meet the requirements under R179 at the
time of issuance of the temporary resident visa or no longer meets
one or more of those requirements;
the foreign national was refused, after the issuance of the temporary
resident visa, an electronic travel authorization, work permit, study
permit or another temporary resident visa;
there are reasonable grounds to believe that the foreign national will
not leave Canada by the end of the period authorized for their stay;
the foreign national is the subject of a declaration made under
subsection 22.1(1) of the Act; or
whether it was issued based on an administrative error;
and cancel the temporary resident visa issued to that foreign
national.

62.
A25(1)
Delegation – Where a foreign national is inadmissible on grounds of
security, human or international rights violations, or organized crime,
grant permanent resident status or an exemption from any
applicable criteria or obligation of the Act if it is justified by
humanitarian or compassionate considerations relating to the
foreign national.
This authority is to be exercised only as it relates to requests for
humanitarian and compassionate consideration by those who made
their request according to the provisions of subsection 25(1) of the
Act in force before June 19, 2013.
